text: Minimum and maximum of the last 1000 values of the changing list
I'm creating an iterative algorithm (Monte Carlo method).
The algorithm returns a value on every iteration, creating a stream of values.
I need to analyze these values and stop the algorithm when say 1000 returned values are withing some epsilon.
I decided to implement it calculation the max and min values of the last 1000 values, and then calculate the error using this formula (max-min)/min and compare it to epsilon: error<=epsilon.
And if this condition is reached, stop the iterations and return the result.
Having all those thoughts in mind I decided to ask here:
How can I solve this task the most efficiently?
